intro: Leiboldia arctioides, commonly known as the Arctic leiboldia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Leiboldia arctioides is an important component of the tundra ecosystem, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
